arts.ttl: Official: Marcenaro to officiate Milan’s game against Bologna – only one precedent
arts.sum: By: Isak Möller Matteo Marcenaro has been named by AIA as the head referee for Milan-Bologna. It will be his second game officiating the Rossoneri, which isn’t so strange when you consider his young age. Milan need to build on their win against Lecce last time out and tomorrow, they will have the chance to do so. Bologna […] The post Official: Marcenaro to officiate Milan’s game against Bologna – only one precedent appeared first on SempreMilan.

arts.ttl: MN: Why Pulisic should start on the bench for Milan against Bologna
arts.sum: By: Isak Möller Christian Pulisic is expected to start on the bench in Milan-Bologna tomorrow given his recent schedule, and the fact that Max Allegri likes his super-sub qualities. Pulisic remains a key player for Milan, having done very well so far this season. arts.ttl: GdS: Milan’s predicted XI for Bologna clash – Rabiot could play from start
arts.sum: By: Isak Möller AC Milan will face Bologna tomorrow evening and Max Allegri could give the new signing Adrien Rabiot the chance from start immediately. After one defeat and one win, against Cremonese and Lecce respectively, Milan are taking on Bologna at San Siro. arts.sum: Christian Pulisic is the star of Mauricio Pochettino’s United States team, despite the tensions last summer when Milan’s number 11 chose not to respond to the national team call-up for the Gold Cup in order to rest and recharge ahead of this season.
